element.name: Subject

element.name: Title
element.description: A name given to the resource

elementText.text: The Danger of a Single Story

element.name: Description
element.description: An account of the resource

elementText.text: Ted Talk by Chimamanda Adichie- discusses growing up in Lagos Nigeria and how not seeing herself in children's books taught her about her place in literature. She explores the danger of having a "single story" about a person or culture.

element.name: Description
element.description: An account of the resource

elementText.text: From description: Douglas Kellner, Professor George F. Kneller Philosophy of Education Chair at UCLA, describes the hidden curriculum in modern education. Schooling tends to be a conservative force; it propagates the status quo. What can we do to make education more progressive?

itemType.name: Text
itemType.description: A resource consisting primarily of words for reading. Examples include books, letters, dissertations, poems, newspapers, articles, archives of mailing lists. Note that facsimiles or images of texts are still of the genre Text.
